page.title: 03Flora & Fauna of Stockton
page.content: This rural landscape is dominated by 3 major land uses-pastoral & arable farming;natural woodland;afforested woodland.The plateau levels are devoted to farming,with the steeper slopes of Apley Terrace, the Severn Valley,Winscott Hill & Acorn Hill under woodland.The Severn Valley area once formed part of Apley Deer Park & therefore has a landscaped emparked look about it,with beautiful copses of oak,ash,elm & chestnut.Apley Terrace is afforested with conifers,Douglas Firs,Sitka Spruce,European Larch & Scots Pine,both for commercial timber & also for cover for a valuable pheasant population.The parish abounds with abundant wildlife,from the fishes & river birds of the Severn,to the foxes,badgers & woodland birds of the wooded habitat, to the hares,rabbits & field birds of the farmland.
